intro: Rhagadiolus creticus, commonly known as the Cretan rhagadion, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Crete. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white, typically during the spring season. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in rocky or limestone soils. It is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rhagadiolus creticus is considered a vulnerable species.
